div.p:
Your letter of June 9: If you require Goldie, Efik Dictionary,
Rev. Hugh Goldie, Dictionary of the Efik language, Edinburgh: United Presbyterian College Buildings, [1870].
write to Friederich Muller, Friedrich Müller (1854-1898), österr. Linguist u. Ethnograph; vgl. HSA 07571-07585. – Im Sinne von: „vielleicht haben Sie Dr. F. Müller schon befragt“? and bow his copy: he has the book; if this does not succeed – write to Dr R Rost – India Office: Westminster Reinhold Rost (1822-1896), Bibliothekar u. Orientalist; vgl. HSA 09722-09797. – he promises to lend you his copy

Write a letter in English to Archdeacon Dandeson Crowther,
Dandeson Crowther (1844-1938), Archdeacon of the The Niger from 1876-1926; Sohn von Samuel Ajayi Crowther, vgl. HSA 02036 (von Wolf, Nachlaß , 15 fälschlich dem Vater, Bischof Samuel Ajayi Crowther zugewiesen. son of the Bishop, who is now in England – his address is Church Mission Home
Salisbury Square London: he will reply – the ddDivinitatis Doctor? Bishop has no time.
Kohler, book on Bonny Sprache (Gottingen) is not worth having. I have a copy I have small Primers or Vocabularies of

I could lend them to you if you will wait till my Book is out – it will be published in September, and will tell
you a great deal

Nothing has been published about the Calabar Languages except Goldie’s Books
Hugh Goldie, Calabar and its mission, Edinburgh [u.a.]: Oliphant Anderson & Ferrier, 1890 ; Ders., Memoir of King Ëyo VII of Old Calabar. A Christian King of Africa, Edinburgh 1894.
– I know nothing about the Neger gehein Sprachen,Vgl.
Schuchardt, „[Rez. von:] Coelho, F. Adolpho, Os dialectos romanicos ou neo-latinos na Africa, Asia e America. Notas complementares“, Literaturblatt für germanische und romanische Philologie 4, 1883, 279-282 , Sp. 282: „Die (auf afri¬kanischer Grundlage ruhende) Geheimsprache der ‘ñáñigos’ werde ich zum Gegenstand einer besonderen Untersuchung machen“. to which you allude, nor have I seen Dr BartramsNicht identifiziert, oder sollte es sich um den Naturforscher William Bartram (1739-1823) handeln? article on that subject.
The Bishops of Calcutta and Bombay would not reply to letters on such subjects – they are too busy

postscript.p:
Of course you have Koelles Polyglotta africána
Sigismund Wilhelm Koelle, Polyglotta africana or a comparative vocabulary of nearly three hundred words and phrases in more than one hundred distinct African languages, London: Church Missionary House, 1854.
